title: Breaking Bad fans are freaking out over major character return in El Camino
text:
El Camino gives a fitting farewell to Jesse Pinkman (Picture: Ben Rothstein/Netflix via AP)

Warning: Contains huge spoilers for Breaking Bad movie El Camino.

El Camino: A Breaking Bad movie treats fans to a number of returning characters from the main show, but there’s one comeback standing above the rest.

The new Netflix film picks up directly after Breaking Bad’s season five finale, as Jesse Pinkman (Aaron Paul) is hunted by law enforcement after escaping a white supremacist compound.

The movie returns to many beloved characters from the show through flashbacks, with the opening scene featuring Mike Ehrmantraut (Jonathan Banks) who encourages Jesse to start a new life in Alaska.

The big question was whether Walter White (Bryan Cranston) would make a return after being killed in the show’s final episode – and luckily the movie knew exactly what fans wanted.

Walter and Jesse are given a flashback scene together (Picture: Netflix)

Walter makes his return in El Camino (Picture: Netflix)

Walter returned alongside Jesse for a light-hearted flashback scene in a diner before their partnership had turned sour, as Jesse mulls over the idea of going to college.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Speaking to Jesse, Walter says: ‘You’re really lucky, you know that. You didn’t have to wait your whole life to do something special.’

The moment in question left many fans in an emotionally fragile place.

I kinda lose hope when they said Walter White is really dead.

But when the Heisenberg shows up…

EPIC MOMENT! #ElCamino #BreakingBad pic.twitter.com/UcWsYYt9m6 — JancoegMan (@AzriiantoTeguh) October 11, 2019

*El Camino flashbacks from Breaking Bad era when Walter White and Jesse Pinkman were still in a happier state and were partners for real* Me:#BreakingBad #ElCamino #ElCaminoABreakingBadMovie pic.twitter.com/fG98UUUwq0 — Alphina (@maleedus) October 11, 2019

This scene really makes me crazy. I'm seriously can't control my emotions. First I thought Walter white is alive. Then I realised it was just a old memory. But this scene really means everything to me. I have no more words man. I'm gonna frame this photo on my wall. ❤️#ElCamino pic.twitter.com/O8YuVoW6nl — Faiq (@therealfaiq) October 11, 2019

"You're really lucky, you know that. You didn't have to wait your whole life to do something special." – Walter White. #ElCamino pic.twitter.com/RmwbHyWqmD — Islam Mohamed (@islamtweetz) October 11, 2019

It wasn’t the only character return either. Todd Alquist (Jessie Plemons) is given particular attention in a scene where he buries his house cleaner, while Skinny Pete (Charles Baker) and Brandon ‘Badger’ Mayhew (Matthew Lee Jones) are Jesse’s first house call.

The final key return came from Jesse’s former girlfriend Jane Margolis (Krysten Ritter), who died back in season two from a drug overdose as Walter watched on.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Other character returns include Jesse’s parents Adam and Diane, Old Joe from the scrapyard, and Clarence the pimp from spin-off Better Call Saul season 4.

You can check out Metro.co.uk’s verdict on El Camino here.

El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie is available on Netflix now.

description: El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie saw many classic characters make a comeback via flashbacks.
